text: Mário Esteves Coluna (; 6 August 1935 – 25 February 2014) was a Portuguese footballer. He played mainly as a central midfielder. He spent most of his career with Benfica, appearing in 525 official games and scoring 127 goals during 16 professional seasons. Dubbed Monstro Sagrado (Sacred Monster) he won 19 major titles with his main club, including ten national leagues and two European Cups. Coluna represented Portugal at the 1966 World Cup, playing nearly 60 times. Coluna died on 25 February 2014 at the age of 78 in Maputo, after not being able to overcome a pulmonary infection. ==Honours== Benfica *Primeira Liga: 1954–55, 1956–57, 1959–60, 1960–61, 1962–63, 1963–64, 1964–65, 1966–67, 1967–68, 1968–69 *Taça de Portugal: 1954–55, 1956–57, 1958–59, 1961–62, 1963–64, 1968–69 *European Cup: 1960–61, 1961–62 *Intercontinental Cup runner-up: 1961, 1962 Portugal *FIFA World Cup third-place: 1966 Individual *World Soccer World XI: 1963, 1964, 1965, 1966 *FIFA World Cup All- Star Team: 1966 *FIFA XI: 1967 ==References== ==Other websites== * *Profile at Zerozero *Stats at ForaDeJogo Category:1935 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Mozambican sportspeople Category:Portuguese footballers Category:1966 FIFA World Cup players Category:Portugal at the 1966 FIFA World Cup
